column4: This concept allows new classes to be derived from existing classes. The derived class inherits all the features of the base class
column5: enabling code reusability and the hierarchical organization of classes. It means that he derived class can be use the fields and methods of the base class
column6: along with its own unique attributes. This relationship is fundamental in object-oriented programming
column7: enabling more complex behaviours to be built upon simpler ones.
